basics.name: Johnathan W. Smith
basics.headline: Senior Early-Childhood Development Specialist
basics.address: 2002 Front Range Way, Fort Collins CO 80525

careerSummary: Early-childhood educator and program manager with 12 years’ experience leading multidisciplinary teams, designing evidence-based curricula, and securing > $1 million in grant funding. Passionate about inclusive learning environments.

education.institution: University of Arkansas at Little Rock
University of Arkansas at Little Rock

employmentHistory.title: Program Director
bullets: Oversee daily operations for a 120-child special-needs facility with a staff of 45.
Launched a STEM-based sensory curriculum adopted by 4 partner schools.
Reduced staff turnover from 22 % to 9 % via mentorship & quarterly workshops.

employmentHistory.title: Counseling Supervisor
bullets: Managed caseloads for 150 adult clients with developmental disabilities.
Implemented digital record-keeping that cut documentation time by 35 %.

employmentHistory.title: Client Specialist
bullets: Co-taught inclusive classrooms (K-5) with focus on adaptive technology.
Trained 25+ teachers on IEP compliance and differentiated instruction.

projects.name: Inclusive Play Toolkit
projects.description: Open-source library of 50+ sensory-friendly classroom activities, downloaded 12 000 times globally.

projects.name: GrantTrack CRM
projects.description: Custom Airtable/Make.com workflow that tracks grant applications and automates reminders; improved funding hit-rate by 18 %.

achievements: 2022 — Secured $450 000 DOE grant for rural early-learning initiatives
2021 — Speaker at SXSW EDU: "Designing Sensory-Rich STEM Labs"
